body:
Fitzsimmons, Rob wrote:
> Hello
> Newbie here! I know enough about Unix to be dangerous


I know a little more than you, which simply means I'm even more 
dangerous.  =8-)


> Ive DL'd the binaries and distribution.
> I've read posts about installing, and I'm still confused.
> According to the readme, it says type
> makeall install    into the Terminal
> 
> That did'nt work, so I typed 
> [sudo ./makeall install -- (I know sudo is superuser do - but not sure why
> the ./ for makeall)


The ./ means "run this program right here in the current directory, even 
tho it's not on my search path."  And that stupid little period eluded 
me for a long time.


> It got me further - asking for places to install the binaries and the lib
> Where do you want the executables [/usr/local/bin]?  I hit return  so far so
> good...


Terrance will be the authority here, but I got the impression that the 
CD contained not only a bootable Linux OS but also a set of 
pre-installed binaries for Radiance.  Did you have a look in 
/usr/local/bin to see if the radiance progs are already in there?  I'm 
pretty sure it's ready to go.








      Rob Guglielmetti
